isis.stitle: RADIATOR/COOLING SYSTEM SERVICE MANUAL - PROSTAR™ - COOLING PACKAGE COMPONENTS - RADIATOR ASSEMBLY

note.para: The grille must be removed from the hood to gain access to the radiator assembly.

step1.para: Remove four screws from the lower portion of the grille ( Figure 19, Item 4).
To remove the grille, lift the grille out to release the tabs from the tab inserts ( Figure 19).
Remove nut from P-clamps securing the A/C lines to the top channel plate ( Figure 8, Items 1 and 2).
Remove two nuts from the A/C condenser top mount brackets ( Figure 8, Items 6 and 7).
Carefully remove the A/C condenser by raising the A/C condenser over the top of the cooling package and securing the A/C condenser out of the way ( Figure 9).
Remove two mount nuts and one bottom mount bolt from the surge tank ( Figure 7, Items 2 and 3). Secure surge tank away from fan shroud.
Loosen two spring clamps and remove the left charge air cooler hose ( Figure 10, Items 2 and 3).
Remove two bolts and washers from the top fan shroud ( Figure 11, Items 1 and 2).
Beginning with the top plastic hold tab, release three plastic hold tabs and remove the top fan shroud ( Figure 11, Item 3).
Remove six nuts, lock washers, and washers from the radiator fan ( Figure 12).
Remove the radiator fan from the fan drive.
Remove three bolts and washers from the bottom fan shroud ( Figure 14, Items 1 and 2).
Remove bottom fan shroud from radiator.

caution.para: Prior to disconnecting the tilt assist cylinder, position a padded support under the hood.

step1.para: With the aid of an assistant, remove retainer pin and disconnect the hood tilt assist cylinder from the top channel plate ( Figure 31).
Gently lower the hood onto a padded support.
Loosen two spring clamps and remove right charge air cooler pipe with hoses ( Figure 32, Items 6 and 7).

note.para: The button snaps may not be reusable, new button snaps may be needed for proper installation of the recirculation seals.

step1.para: Remove two button snaps from recirculation seals ( Figure 32, Items 1 and 3).
Remove four bolts and top channel bracket from charge air cooler ( Figure 32, Items 2 and 4).
Remove two bolts from the charge air cooler ( Figure 32, Item 8).
Remove four bolts from the charge air cooler ( Figure 33, Item 1).
With aid of an assistant, remove the charge air cooler from the radiator upper frame plate ( Figure 33, Items 2 and 3).
Locate the radiator drain valve, prior to removal of the radiator assembly. Place tray under the radiator to collect coolant from radiator. Open drain valve and drain coolant.
Remove mount bracket nut securing power steering hoses on the left radiator frame.
Remove two bolts from the power steering reservoir and secure power steering reservoir out of the way.

caution.para: Exercise care when removing the transmission oil cooler as there is minimal clearance between the hood torsion bar and the transmission oil cooler. Failure to comply could result in damage to the transmission oil cooler.

step1.para: Cover the end of the hood torsion bar with cardboard or a similar material to protect the transmission oil cooler from damage.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. TRANSMISSION OIL COOLER MOUNT BRACKET BOLTS

step1.para: Disconnect radiator ground wire.
Remove rear transmission oil cooler tube bracket bolt ( Figure 37, Item 6).
Remove two bolts from bottom of the transmission oil cooler.
Remove two bolts from transmission oil cooler mount bracket and secure transmission oil cooler out of the way.
Loosen spring clamp on left radiator hose, slide spring clamp past fitting bead on left radiator hose, and remove left radiator hose from radiator.
Remove bolt, nut, and washer from left radiator stay rod and stay rod mount bracket.
Remove mount nut and lower mount bushing from left radiator mount bolt.
Remove radiator to surge tank hose.
Remove bolt, nut, and washer from right radiator stay rod and stay rod mount bracket.
Loosen spring clamp on right radiator hose, slide spring clamp past fitting bead on radiator hose, and remove right radiator hose from radiator outlet connection.
Remove two bolts and right bumper latch bracket from mega bracket.
Remove mount nut and lower mount bushing from right radiator mount bolt.
With the aid of an assistant, remove the radiator assembly from the right side of chassis.
Remove two radiator mount bolts and upper mount bushings from the bottom of the radiator assembly.
Secure the radiator assembly in a safely supported position on the floor or workbench.
With the aid of an assistant, place radiator assembly in vehicle from the right side of chassis ( Figure 40).
Install two radiator mount bolts and upper mount bushings on the bottom of the radiator assembly ( Figure 40, Items 2 and 3).

Install two nuts and bushings on bottom of radiator assembly and ensure mount bolts and bushings are aligned properly ( Figure 39, Items 4 and 5) ( Figure 37, Items 6 and 7). Torque nuts to 65 to 79 lbf-ft (88 to 107 N•m).
Install two bolts and right bumper latch bracket on mega bracket ( Figure 39, Items 6 and 7).
Install right radiator hose on radiator outlet connection and secure with spring clamp ( Figure 39, Items 1, 2, and 3). Torque spring clamp to 6 lbf-ft (8 N•m).
Install bolt, washer, and nut on right radiator stay rod and stay rod mount bracket ( Figure 38, Items 2 and 4). Torque bolt to 66 to 85 lbf-ft (90 to 115 N•m).
Connect radiator to surge tank hose ( Figure 38, Item 1).
Install bolt, washer, and nut on left radiator stay rod and stay rod mount bracket ( Figure 37, Items 1, 2, and 3). Torque bolt to 66 to 85 lbf-ft (90 to 115 N•m).
Install left radiator hose on radiator inlet connection and secure with spring clamp ( Figure 37, Items 4 and 9). Torque spring clamp to 6 lbf-ft (8 N•m).
Align transmission oil cooler mount bracket on radiator frame and secure with two bolts ( Figure 36, Items 1 and 6). Torque bolts to 33 to 40 lbf-ft (45 to 54 N•m).
Install two bolts in bottom of transmission oil cooler ( Figure 36, Item 3). Torque bolts to 33 to 40 lbf-ft (45 to 54 N•m).
Install bolt in rear transmission oil cooler tube bracket ( Figure 37, Item 6).
Connect radiator ground wire.
Align the power steering reservoir on the left side of the radiator and secure with two bolts ( Figure 34, Items 1 and 2). Torque bolts to 41 to 50 lbf-ft (56 to 68 N•m).
Install nut on mount bracket securing power steering hoses on the left radiator frame ( Figure 34, Items 4 and 5).
With aid of an assistant, position charge air cooler on the radiator upper frame plate ( Figure 33, Items 2 and 3).
Install four bolts on the front of the charge air cooler ( Figure 33, Item 1). Torque bolts to 52 to 59 lbf-ft (71 to 80 N•m).
Install two mount bolts on the back of the charge air cooler ( Figure 32, Item 8). Torque bolts to 52 to 59 lbf-ft (71 to 80 N•m).
Align top channel plate on charge air cooler and secure with four bolts ( Figure 32, Items 2 and 4). Torque bolts to 52 to 59 lbf-ft (71 to 80 N•m).
Install two button snaps on recirculation seals ( Figure 32, Items 1 and 3).
Install right charge air cooler pipe with hoses and secure with two spring clamps ( Figure 32, Items 6 and 7). Torque spring clamps to 6 lbf-ft (8 N•m).
With the aid of an assistant, install the hood tilt assist cylinder and secure retainer pin ( Figure 31).
Install the bottom fan shroud on the radiator.
Secure bottom fan shroud with three washers and bolts ( Figure 14, Items 1 and 2). Torque bolts to 13 to 14 lbf-ft (18 to 19 N•m).
Install the radiator fan on the fan drive.
Install six washers, lock washers, and nuts on the radiator fan ( Figure 12). Torque nuts to 25 lbf-ft (34 N•m).
Align the top fan shroud on the bottom fan shroud and engage the three plastic hold tabs ( Figure 11, Item 3).
Secure the top fan shroud with two washers and bolts ( Figure 11, Items 1 and 2). Torque bolts to 13 to 14 lbf-ft (18 to 19 N•m).
Install left charge air cooler hose and secure with two spring clamps ( Figure 10, Items 2 and 3). Torque spring clamps to 6 lbf-ft (8 N•m).
Position surge tank on cooling package and secure with two nuts and one bolt ( Figure 7, Items 2 and 3). Torque nuts and bolt to 13 to 14 lbf-ft (18 to 19 N•m).
Position the A/C condenser on the bottom mount bracket, make sure the A/C condenser is seated properly on the bottom mount bracket ( Figure 8, Items 4 and 8).
Align the A/C condenser top mount brackets on the top channel plate and secure with two washers and nuts ( Figure 8, Items 6 and 7). Torque nuts to 13 to 14 lbf-ft (18 to 19 N•m).
Install nut on P-clamps securing the A/C lines to the top channel plate and tighten ( Figure 8, Items 1 and 2).

note.para: Prior to installing the grille, inspect the mounting tabs on the upper surface of the grille and the tab inserts on the hood. Insure that all tabs and tab inserts are functional and in place.

step1.para: Align grille insert tabs with the hood insert holes ( Figure 19, Item 2).
With the palm of your hand, press the grille at all six insert tab locations to seat grille onto the hood.
Install four mount screws in bottom of grille ( Figure 19, Item 4). Torque screws to 4 to 5 lbf-ft (6 to 7 N•m).
Fill coolant system to proper level and leak test the system. Special Tool number 550500INT is preferred to fill and leak test the coolant system.
